item.description:
Meetup & JREX Joint Social Gathering

Network, make new friends having some sushi and beer hearing interesting story of John Manjiro!

Guest speaker: Mr. Atsushi Tanimura who played John Manjiro for an NHK historic documentary film

John Manjiro was one of the first Japanese people to visit the United States.(1841)

John Manjiro: A Japanese fisherman, who was rescued by an American whaler and brought to America.
Convinced Japan to end its isolationist policy(sakoku)
The first Japanese person to wear a tie.
Introduced the alphabet song to Japan.

The impact John Manjiro had on Japanese and American culture is enormous.

A museum recently built in Fairhaven, Massachusetts, in memory of him.(Opened on May 7, 2009)

Check him out at: www.manjiro.org He is quite a guy!

-------------------------------------
JREX - The Japanese Resource Exchange

This is a networking/support group for Japanese/Japan related entrepreneurs in the New England area.
Join us if you have ever dreamed of starting your own business, or already have in the US.
* Operated in Japanese

--------------------------------------

We will be serving a light meal, alcohol, and desert. It is a 21+ event.

Archstone Northpoint is a 3min walk from the Lechmere T station on Green-line.
Street parking or Public Parking $5.50
Google My Map http://tinyurl.com/dg...

Please make a reservation at: http://www.jrex.us...
item.name: Meeup & JREX Joint Social Gathering - John Manjiro~ The First Japanese in the US
